get.description: Returns AllergyIntolerances based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size & _pretty are query parameters used for Paging).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the AllergyIntolerance. Sample ids are: 11408, 11414, 10709, 19563, 19330.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: food | medication | environment - Category of Substance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: criticality
parameters.description: low | high | unassessible - Estimated potential clinical harm. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Recorded date/time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Recorded date/time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External Ids for AllergyIntolerance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: last-date
parameters.description: Date(/time) of last known occurence of a reaction. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: last-date
parameters.description: Date(/time) of last known occurence of a reaction. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: manifestation
parameters.description: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date(/time) when manifestations showed. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date(/time) when manifestations showed. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who the sensitivity is for (Patient).

parameters.name: recorder
parameters.description: Who recorded the sensitivity (Patient,Practitioner).

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description: Source of the information about the allergy (Patient,Practitioner,RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: How the subject was exposed to the substance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: unconfirmed | confirmed | resolved | refuted | entered-in-error. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: substance
parameters.description: Substance, (or class) considered to be responsible for risk. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: immune | non-immune - Underlying mechanism (if known). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: AllergyIntolerance resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of AllergyIntolerance resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: food | medication | environment - Category of Substance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: criticality
parameters.description: low | high | unassessible - Estimated potential clinical harm. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Recorded date/time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Recorded date/time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External Ids for AllergyIntolerance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: last-date
parameters.description: Date(/time) of last known occurence of a reaction. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: last-date
parameters.description: Date(/time) of last known occurence of a reaction. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: manifestation
parameters.description: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date(/time) when manifestations showed. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date(/time) when manifestations showed. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who the sensitivity is for (Patient).

parameters.name: recorder
parameters.description: Who recorded the sensitivity (Patient,Practitioner).

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description: Source of the information about the allergy (Patient,Practitioner,RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: How the subject was exposed to the substance. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: unconfirmed | confirmed | resolved | refuted | entered-in-error. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: substance
parameters.description: Substance, (or class) considered to be responsible for risk. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: immune | non-immune - Underlying mechanism (if known). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

200.description: The set of resources associated with a particular allergy.
